data.enText: a quantity or thickness of sth that lies over a surface or between surfaces

data.chText: 所有的物品上都积了薄薄的一层灰尘。
data.enText: A thin layer of dust covered everything.
How many layers of clothing are you wearing?
a level or part within a system or set of ideas
There were too many layers of management in the company.

data.chText: 这首诗不同层次的含义
data.enText: the layers of meaning in the poem

data.chText: 把土豆和洋葱分层放在盘子里。
data.enText: Layer the potatoes and onions in a dish.
Her hair had been layered (= cut to several different lengths) .

ex.enText: The table was covered by a film of dust.

ex.chText: 可以明显地看到杯子里的水上面有一层油。
ex.enText: It can be clearly seen that there is a film of oil on the surface of the water in the cup.

synonyms.bx: 指某物表面上覆盖的薄薄的一层液体、粉末等。
指某物表面所涂的很薄的一层涂料或其他物质。

ex.chText: 家具上蒙了一层厚厚的灰尘。
ex.enText: There was a thick layer of dust on the furniture.

ex.chText: 你怎么穿了这么多层衣服啊？
ex.enText: Why do you wear so many layers of clothing?

synonyms.bx: 指覆盖在某物表面上或夹在其他两物之间的一层材料或物质，可厚可薄。

ex.enText: The top of the building was hidden beneath a veil of mist.

ex.chText: 月亮躲在薄薄的云层后面，外面就更黑了。
ex.enText: It was darker outside because the moon was hidden behind a veil of clouds.

synonyms.bx: 指使人视线模糊的一层薄薄的雾、云、烟等。

tr: thin structure composed of a single thickness of cells
single thickness of usually some homogeneous substance
example: slices of hard-boiled egg on a bed of spinach

tr: an abstract place usually conceived as having depth
example: a good actor communicates on several levels
a simile has at least two layers of meaning
the mind functions on many strata simultaneously

tr: a relatively thin sheetlike expanse or region lying over or under another

value.def: A layer of a material or substance is a quantity or piece of it that covers a surface or that is between two other things.

example.ex: A fresh layer of snow covered the street...
Arrange all the vegetables except the potatoes in layers.
example.tran: 把除土豆外的所有蔬菜分层放置。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: If something such as a system or an idea has many layers, it has many different levels or parts.

example.ex: ...an astounding ten layers of staff between the factory worker and the chief executive...
example.tran: 工厂工人和首席执行官之间10个等级的巨大差距

example.ex: Critics and the public puzzle out the layers of meaning in his photos.
example.tran: 评论界和公众揭开了他照片中的重重深意。

value.def: If you layer something, you arrange it in layers.

example.ex: Layer the potatoes, asparagus and salmon in the tin...
example.tran: 把土豆、芦笋和大麻哈鱼分层装入罐头内。

example.ex: By lifting and layering her hair, Michael created a lighter frame for her face.
example.tran: 通过把头发往上梳，增加层次感，迈克尔让她的脸型显得更为柔和。

trans: 边（临）界层；附（界）面层；界限层；分解面
应用层；應用層；第七层应用层；应用程式层；应用层面
薄层色谱；薄层色谱法；薄层层析；薄层层析法；层析
網路層；網絡層；网层；网络层；第三层是网络层
物理层；實體層；实体层；第一层物理层；物理层模块
上层；高层；较高层；面层；上方的阶层
